page.title: 05DISTANT HORIZONS
page.content: Looking northwards from the shores of Lochryan, at Stranraer, we are looking up to the Firth of Clyde. The first thing we are confronted with on the horizon is the mighty bulk of The Ailsa Craig, 940 feet in height and 15 miles away.At a distance of some 30 miles, the hills of Arran are sharply outlined and finally is the more distant coastline of the Mull of Kintyre.On Lochryan itself yachting was a popular pastime. The local lairds and landowners held 2 and 3 day regattas.Older residents of the town still talk nostalgically of the fine sights they have seen.Now there are smaller yachts, dinghies and windsurfers on the Loch which give cosiderable pleasure to those who participate and also to those who spectate on the shores of Lochryan.
